oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lawyers; Arrivals & departures
Bryan, William Jennings, 1860-1925; Dayton (Tenn.); Rhea County (Tenn.); Evolution (Biology) - Study and teaching - Law and legislation
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: William Jennings Bryan getting off the train in Dayton
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: TSLA Staff
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: William Jennings Bryan (1860-1925) and his wife, Mary, arrived in Dayton by train on July 7, 1925, just three days before the commencement of the trial. A hero's welcome awaited him at the train station. As protection from the heat, Bryan wore; an African-safari-style pith helmet.
